skill.name: API Integration Specialist
skill.description: Expert in integrating third-party APIs with proper authentication, error handling, rate limiting, and retry logic. Use when integrating REST APIs, GraphQL endpoints, webhooks, or external services. Specializes in OAuth flows, API key management, request/response transformation, and building robust API clients.

skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-only skill containing documentation and code examples. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access. The content promotes security best practices for API integration.

content.value_statement: Building API integrations is complex and error-prone. This skill provides expert guidance on authentication, error handling, rate limiting, and retry logic to create reliable, secure API clients.
actual_capabilities: Design secure API client libraries with proper authentication patterns
Implement OAuth 2.0 flows and token management
Build retry logic with exponential backoff for resilience
Create rate limiting strategies to avoid API throttling
Verify webhook signatures for secure event handling
Transform API responses to internal data models
limitations: Does not execute API calls - provides guidance only
Does not include specific API provider credentials
Does not handle payment processing directly
Requires developer implementation based on provided patterns

use_cases.title: Build API Client Libraries
use_cases.description: Create reusable, secure API client libraries with proper error handling and retry logic

use_cases.title: Integrate Third-Party Services
use_cases.description: Connect to services like Stripe, Twilio, or SendGrid with production-ready patterns

use_cases.title: Implement Webhook Handlers
use_cases.description: Set up secure webhook endpoints with signature verification and event processing

prompt_templates.title: Basic API Client
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me build an API client for [SERVICE_NAME]. I need to implement authentication using API keys stored in environment variables, proper error handling, and retry logic with exponential backoff.

prompt_templates.title: OAuth Flow
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through implementing OAuth 2.0 authorization code flow for [SERVICE_NAME]. Include token exchange, refresh logic, and secure storage of credentials.

prompt_templates.title: Webhook Security
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a secure webhook handler for [SERVICE_NAME]. I need signature verification, event parsing, and proper error responses.

prompt_templates.title: Rate Limiting
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a rate limiting strategy for my API client. I need to track request counts, implement backoff when throttled, and gracefully handle 429 responses.

output_examples.input: Help me integrate the Stripe API for payment processing
output: Use environment variables for Stripe secret key: process.env.STRIPE_SECRET_KEY
Create API client with proper error handling for 4xx and 5xx responses
Implement exponential backoff retry for transient failures
Handle rate limits with proper 429 response processing
Verify webhook signatures using Stripe-Signature header and HMAC SHA256
Log all API interactions for debugging and monitoring

best_practices: Store all API credentials in environment variables or secrets management systems
Implement exponential backoff retry logic for transient failures
Always verify webhook signatures before processing incoming events
anti_patterns: Hardcoding API keys directly in source code
Ignoring rate limit responses and continuing to spam the API
Skipping error handling for network failures or invalid responses

faq.question: Which authentication methods are supported?
faq.answer: The skill covers API keys, OAuth 2.0 (Authorization Code, Client Credentials flows), JWT tokens, and Bearer token authentication.

faq.question: What rate limits should I expect?
faq.answer: Rate limits vary by API provider. The skill provides patterns to handle 429 responses with backoff strategies.

faq.question: Can I use this for GraphQL APIs?
faq.answer: Yes. The patterns for authentication, error handling, and retry logic apply to GraphQL endpoints with appropriate query construction.

faq.question: Is my API key data safe?
faq.answer: The skill emphasizes storing credentials in environment variables only. No credentials are transmitted or stored by this skill.

faq.question: Why am I getting 401 errors?
faq.answer: Check API key validity, token expiration, proper Authorization header format, and required OAuth scopes for the requested endpoint.

faq.question: How does this compare to using official SDKs?
faq.answer: The skill provides low-level patterns useful when official SDKs are unavailable or when you need custom integration logic beyond SDK capabilities.
